Kaplıca was a Greek Cypriot village before 1974. After the war, the village was depopulated and resettled by Turkish mainlanders. Following the general pattern, the village is in a worse condition than those populated by Turkish Cypriots.

Today, the village has a popular beach with a hotel and many camper vans.
The village lies on the Northern Coastal Highway. There are no buses to and from the village, so the only mode of transport available is the car. It is about a 10 minute drive from
. You may try going to Tatlısu by bus and then hitchhiking from there to Kaplıca.
The village is a 5 minute walk from the hotel on the coast.
